flowRoot.flowPara: We recommend installing miniconda, from Anaconda. It makes managing packages and virtual environments easier. Go here to find it:
Look for the latest version of Python and, unless you know otherwise, get the 64-bit version for your operating system. Download and run the installer.
If you are working in a corporate environment, you likely connect to the Internet through a proxy. Ask your IT department about it; it might look something like https://my-proxy.myco.com:8080

You should make an environment for every major project. You might also want one or two general environments for everyday use. To make one, open an Anaconda prompt (Windows) or Terminal (Mac & Linux), then type:
Once you have it, open an Anaconda prompt (Windows) or Terminal (Mac & Linux), then type:
Change myenv to whatever name you want. You can optionally add the version of Python you want, and/or packages you want. For example:

text.tspan: conda create --name myenv python=3.7 jupyterlab matplotlib scipy

flowRoot.flowPara: Install a kernel to make it easier to use your environment in Jupyter:
Now enter the environment (look for your prompt to change after typing this):
The first time you use it, install a Jupyter kernel so you can use it in a notebook:
jupyterlab, matplotlib and scipy together give you lots of useful scientific tools.
